definitions.definition: to humiliate ; to disrupt somebody's composure or comfort with acting publicly or freely; to abash .
examples: The crowd's laughter and jeers embarrassed him.

definitions.definition: To hinder from liberty of movement; to impede ; to obstruct .
examples: The motion was advanced in order to embarrass the progress of the bill.

definitions.definition: To involve in difficulties concerning money matters; to encumber with debt ; to beset with urgent claims or demands.
examples: A man or his business is embarrassed when he cannot meet his pecuniary engagements.

definitions.definition: To perplex mentally; confuse , disconcert ; catch off guard .

main_definition: ( transitive ) to humiliate ; to disrupt somebody's composure or comfort with acting publicly or freely; to abash .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To hinder from liberty of movement; to impede ; to obstruct .
( transitive ) To involve in difficulties concerning money matters; to encumber with debt ; to beset with urgent claims or demands.
( transitive , formal ) To perplex mentally; confuse , disconcert ; catch off guard .
